content: *now picture this the windswept landscapes of the island of texel where sheep graze amidst rolling dunes in the netherlands over a million kilograms of wool go to waste each year but with daphne a shepherdess and the support of the knit on texel retreat 2024 we set out to change that through experimentation and collaboration we crafted a unique locally sourced yarn that pays homage to texel s heritage enter the link mitts a tribute to vrolijk garen cheerful yarn and a symbol of sustainable fashion while designed to showcase this special yarn these mitts are versatile enough to embrace any fiber inviting knitters everywhere to join us in a celebration of craftsmanship and community whether it s vrolijk garen or your favorite yarn the link mitts promise warmth style and a connection to a story of resilience and innovation * **to further support daphne and express my gratitude to the knitting community i m offering the pattern for the link mitts for free enjoy ** > since the creation of the yarn was an > experiment we produced a very limited > quantity most of which was sold > during the knot retreat if you are > interested in purchasing the last > skeins of daphne s yarn you are welcome to > contact her directly 1 **construction** these mitts are knit in the round from cuff to fingers **sizes** 1 2 3 fits hand circumference 17 5 19 5 21 5 cm / 7 5 7 75 8 5 length 20 21 22 cm / 7 5 8 25 8 75 sample is shown in size 2 **yarn** blend no 1 by vrolijk garen 100 % wool 250 m / 273 yards per 100gr approx 100 115 125 m / 110 126 138 yards when substituting for a more commercially available yarn it s advisable to choose a sport weight yarn **needles** **needle a** for the mitten a set of needle s for working small circumferences in the round in size needed to obtain gauge listed suggested needle size 3 mm / us #2 5 **needle b** for the bind off a short dpn or circular needle suggested needle size 2 75 mm / us #2 **gauge** measured after blocking
